intro: Codonoboea quinquevulnera, commonly known as the five-wound codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Codonoboea quinquevulnera is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
